Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2013 10:09AM Downtowngirl33 wrote: Hi ALF124. I saw the breast surgeon yesterday (the pathology report says I have PASH, PAM and CCL). She isn't concerned at all.. Says I have busy breasts which is common for my age (43). She is going to have my biopsies re-read by a pathologist who specializes in breasts. She agreed to let me get a MRI but I kind of had to talk her into it. As far as the PASH goes her plan is to leave it in unless it gets bigger
Posts.Title: PASH - Pseudoangiomatous stromal hyperplasia gillianinnh djmammo

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2013 03:21PM Downtowngirl33 wrote: Thanks cinnamon smiles. I just opened the envelope of all the films and ultrasounds they gave me and my radiology reports were in there. According to that report I have extremely dense breasts which makes mammography less useful. The breast specialist says they are not that dense.. Not a fan of conflicting info. But I am so glad I asked for the MRI and I will look into it further because I think insurance should help pay due to the density issue.
Posts.Title: to wait or not to wait greentree765 mommaof5

Posts.Content: Apr 14, 2013 10:25AM Downtowngirl33 wrote: Hi green tree. I am 43 with "busy breasts" as they say. I have had 4 biopsies total and the breast specialist is not concerned. I did ask for a MRI which is going to happen next month. Insurance isn't going to pay. She thinks it will be around $400. She said not to be concerned if they call me back because the MRI can pick up false positives. Good luck to you
